result.execSummary:
Todd A. Borden was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Todd A. Borden was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd A. Borden

defendant.name: Borden, Todd A.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Extradition paperwork mailed to Governor Walker's office.
An initial appearance did not happen. Event needs to be in court record in order to dispose of the case.

Defendant Todd A. Borden in Court from Jail w/Atty. Liesl Nelson via phone.  Prosecuting Atty Sean Froelich appeared for State of Wisconsin via phone.  Case called at 4:12 p.m.  Court advises Defendant of rights, he understands.  Defendant signs Waiver of Extradition, Court signs.
